Assist manager to prepare and deliver timely, accurate, and comprehensive financial reports for internal and/or external stakeholders such as profitability, balance sheet, cashflow projection, and financial ratio

Ensure compliance with accounting principles, legal requirements, and company policies

Mandatory experience 2 years minimum in KAP (Public Auditor Firm)
Good communication, well-mannered, straight to the point, proactive
Good analytical thinking and problem-solver

Good proficiency in google spreadsheet and Ms. excel
Solid understanding of SAK

recommendations.title: Senior Corporate Planning Analyst
responsibilities: Plan: Gather the data from all business unit

Do: (a) Ensure there is alignment between management strategy and business units; (b) Identifying, compiling reports, and analyze company business data activities so that it can be evaluated by management; (c) Ensure the data or information that will be processed into reports for management is correct and accurate.
Check: Prepare monthly review with every business unit to plan activities to achieve company's business targets.
Action: Ensure the implementation of the planned activities and provide suggestion to business units that need correction so that they can achieve optimal targets.
requirements: Bachelor's Degree (S1): Any Major
Minimum experiences: 6 years of relevant work experiences (Financial services industries or consulting firms, with expertise in corporate planing considered advantageous)
Maximum work experiences: 9 years
Proficiency in english (passive & active)
Familiarity with the latest trends and developments in the financial services industry especially in general insurance industry

Have an excellent in: (a) Data analysis, financial modeling, and able to derive actionable insights from complex data sets; (b) Using relevant planning and analysis tools; (c) Knowledge of industry-standard software and technologies; (d) Able to adapt to changing business environments and priorities.
Have a strong communication and presentation skills (written & verbal: is a must) to present a complex information to diverse BOD level.
Have an experiences in leading or collaborate with cross-functional teams/projects

recommendations.title: Risk - Corporate Risk, SPX Express
responsibilities: Plan and conduct risk-based reviews/audits of end-to-end business processes
Identify, assess, and test business processes for potential risks and control deficiencies
Provide cost-effective recommendations to mitigate business risks and strengthen internal controls
Identify areas of risk within the organization and propose mitigation strategies
Assist team lead to prepare detailed rewiew/audit reports with findings and recommendations for management presentation
Collaborate with various departments to develop action plans and monitor the implementation of the action plans
Conduct investigation on breach of internal controls and fraud cases/incidents
requirements: Bachelor degree with background financial, accounting, economics, or equivalent
3-5 years of audit/risk experience in the big four public accounting firm or consulting firm, or internal audit experience in logistic company
Professional certification (CIA, QIA, CFE, CFrA, CRMO, CRMP, etc.) will be a plus
Strong knowledge of risk/audit standards, procedures, and regulations
Strong critical thinking, analytical thinking, data analysis, and problem solving skills
Attention to details and high standard of integrity & ethics
Willingness to travel around Indonesia (if required)
